title: Bihar polls: Women voters outshine men; state sees record turnout of 66.9%
content: Bihar witnessed its highest-ever voter turnout, with women significantly outperforming men. Nearly 72% of female electors cast their ballots, compared to 63% of men, driving the overall 66.91% participation. This trend was consistent across both phases of polling, highlighting women's crucial role in this record-breaking election.

title: 'Predictable tactic': India says Pak remark aims to deflect internal power grab
content: India has strongly refuted Pakistan's claims linking New Delhi to a suicide bombing near Islamabad, labeling the accusations "baseless and unfounded." The Ministry of External Affairs stated that Pakistan's allegations are a diversionary tactic to distract from its internal political and constitutional turmoil, a move the international community will not be misled by.

title: Vibe coding: Meta‚Äôs AI chief has advice for teens: Says they should spend time on..
content: Meta's Chief AI Officer, Alexandr Wang, urges teenagers to master AI tools, comparing the current era to the dawn of personal computing. He advises dedicating thousands of hours to 'vibe-coding'‚Äîhands-on experimentation with AI‚Äîto gain a significant advantage in the future economy. This approach emphasizes rapid learning through prompting and refining AI outputs.

title: ‚ÄòReport GPS spoofing within 10 minutes of occurrence:‚Äô DGCA to pilots, ATC
content: DGCA mandates pilots and air traffic controllers to report GPS spoofing within 10 minutes of detection. This new protocol follows unprecedented GPS anomalies at Delhi Airport, where aircraft have experienced incorrect location data and false terrain warnings. The National Security Advisor's office is investigating the issue, which has been common in conflict zones but is a first for Delhi.

title: US govt shutdown: Dems break rank; is Trump about to get his way?
content: Liberal Democrats are reportedly revolting against party leadership, accusing them of surrendering to President Trump on government reopening without securing healthcare subsidy extensions.  This internal dissent follows a new bill to end the shutdown, supported by centrist Democrats, heading to the House.  Activists and some lawmakers are demanding leadership changes, citing a betrayal of their mandate.

title: Chinese Cryptoqueen caught: UK police seize Bitcoin; scam worth billion exposed
content: A Chinese woman has received an 11-year sentence in the UK for laundering millions embezzled from pensioners. Qian Zhimin, who fled China, used a fake passport to enter the UK and lived lavishly. Police seized one of the world's largest crypto hauls, with the Bitcoin's value soaring significantly since its discovery.

title: 1st Test: From Gill to Bumrah - who did what during first Kolkata practice session?
content: Shubman Gill spent nearly 90 minutes in the nets as he adjusted back to red-ball cricket after recent white-ball games. Before batting, head coach Gautam Gambhir and assistant coach Sitanshu Kotak spoke with him near the High Court end, news agency PTI reported. Among the fast bowlers, only Jasprit Bumrah bowled.

title: ‚ÄòDon‚Äôt have notifications‚Äô: JPMorgan chief ignores most texts; keeps phone off at work
content: JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon, despite leading a massive bank, limits his phone use at work, turning off notifications and ignoring texts unless from his children. He prioritizes focus in meetings, believing distractions hinder engagement. Dimon also advocates for US schools to evolve, integrating crucial skills like coding and cybersecurity to prepare students for the modern workforce.

title: Bihar poll of exit polls: NDA to roar back to power with 148 seats; what pollsters said about MGB
content: Exit polls indicate a strong win for the NDA in the Bihar elections. The alliance is expected to secure a majority of seats. The RJD-led Mahagathbandhan is projected to fall short. High voter turnout was recorded in both phases of the polling. The results will shape the political landscape of Bihar.

title: Retired headmaster detained for controversial post on Delhi blast
content: Police have detained Nazrul Islam Borbhuiya, a retired headmaster from Silchar. He posted a controversial comment on social media following the Delhi blast. The post read 'Election is coming'. Authorities are investigating the intent behind the comment. This incident shows increased scrutiny on social media posts about national events. Police aim to stop provocative narratives.

title: Mystery deepens in Marshawn Kneeland‚Äôs death as new final-hour details emerge
content: Dallas Cowboys defensive end Marshawn Kneeland, 24, died from a self-inflicted gunshot wound after a brief police chase and vehicle crash. Authorities received distress calls and "goodbye" texts from Kneeland, who had a history of mental illness. His tragic death has prompted widespread grief and a moment of silence across the NFL, highlighting the unseen struggles athletes face.

title: Michael Ray Richardson death: Mystery deepens after cancer revelation
content: Former basketball star Micheal Ray Richardson has died. He played for the Knicks and Nets and was a four-time NBA All-Star. Richardson's career included overcoming substance abuse issues and coaching overseas. Tributes from the Knicks and his attorney praise his defensive skills and character. Isiah Thomas also spoke highly of his playing ability.

title: Is Stephen Curry playing tonight vs OKC? Warriors star‚Äôs status revealed
content: Warriors fans are holding their breath as Stephen Curry's return from illness remains uncertain ahead of the Oklahoma City Thunder clash. The 37-year-old's lingering cold has sidelined him for three consecutive games, impacting the team's performance. His presence is crucial for the struggling Warriors, currently at an even 5-5 record, as they face a tough schedule.

title: Tracking terror: Car parked near Red Fort for 3 hrs; was there another target?
content: A Hyundai i20 exploded near Delhi's Red Fort, killing at least eight and injuring many. Investigators are tracing the car's 11-hour journey from Faridabad, suspecting a terror attack linked to a wider module. A Pulwama doctor is believed to be the lone, masked driver, possibly a fidayeen attacker. The NIA is now leading the probe.

title: Delhi blast: Car was moving, no crater; key reasons agencies think attackers panicked
content: Initial investigations into a car explosion near Delhi's Red Fort suggest it was not a typical suicide attack, but possibly a premature detonation by a panicked suspect. The blast, which killed at least eight people, did not exhibit the usual modus operandi of suicide bombers, with no crater or shrapnel found.

title: Rs 23.75cr too high': KKR questioned for Venkatesh Iyer decision
content: Former Australian captain Aaron Finch advises Kolkata Knight Riders to reconsider Venkatesh Iyer's hefty Rs 23.75 crore retention. Finch believes Iyer's current middle-order role, without bowling, doesn't justify the price, despite past match-winning performances. He suggests releasing Iyer to free up funds and potentially reacquiring him at a more balanced cost.

title: Caught in doping! India's Asiad medalist slapped with five-year ban
content: Incheon Asian Games medallist Manju Bala faces a five-year ban for doping violations, testing positive for steroids and SARMS.  Several other athletes, including Mohan Saini, bodybuilders, a boxer, a canoeist, and a basketball player, have also received suspensions ranging from two to six years.  A sprinter's four-year ban was also upheld.

title: Will Smith watches in shock as Sharks‚Äô Macklin Celebrini injured, loses teeth
content: During the game against the Anaheim Ducks, San Jose Sharks rookie Macklin Celebrini hurt his face badly and lost a few teeth. Will Smith, a teammate, saw the whole thing happen and his shocked reaction went viral. Even though it hurt, Celebrini's toughness and quick return to the bench showed how dedicated he was to the game.

title: Naroditsky‚Äôs tragic death: FIDE files formal complaint against Kramnik
content: FIDE has filed a formal complaint against former World Champion Vladimir Kramnik with its Ethics & Disciplinary Commission. The complaint addresses Kramnik's repeated public accusations of cheating against deceased GM Daniel Naroditsky and GM David Navara, citing harassment and insult to dignity. The EDC will now review the evidence and testimony.

title: Bihar exit polls: Pollsters predict landslide for NDA - but how accurate were they last time
content: Exit polls for Bihar's assembly elections suggest the ruling NDA is poised to retain power, with the opposition Mahagathbandhan falling short of a majority. Prashant Kishor's Jan Suraaj is not expected to secure any seats. Despite high voter turnout, historical trends show exit polls have often misjudged Bihar's electoral outcomes.

title: Are you still randomly applying to jobs? Alan Stein's networking strategy that actually works
content: In today‚Äôs crowded job market, sending endless applications often yields little result. Career expert Alan Stein advocates prioritizing networking over applying, introducing his ‚ÄúFive Chats Rule‚Äù‚Äîhaving five meaningful conversations weekly with professionals in target companies. These interactions build trust, uncover hidden opportunities, and give job-seekers a human edge, turning curiosity and connections into career growth.

title: Bihar exit polls show NDA sweep: JD(U) says 'stamp' on Nitish govt; 'not accurate', says Cong
content: Exit polls predict a sweeping victory for the NDA in Bihar, with leaders celebrating the predicted outcome. Conversely, Mahagathbandhan leaders dismissed the polls as speculative, expressing confidence in their own victory. The counting of votes is scheduled for Friday.

title: 'Hunt down each & every culprit': Amit Shah says Delhi blast culprits to face 'full wrath of agencies'
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah has ordered a relentless pursuit to apprehend all individuals involved in the devastating i20 car blast near the Red Fort. The high-intensity explosion claimed at least 12 lives and injured 30, with Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Defence Minister Rajnath Singh vowing that perpetrators will face severe justice.

title: Why does poop sometimes float instead of sink? What does it say about health
content: Floating stools can occur due to increased gas or excess fat, often linked to diet or temporary digestive issues. While occasional floating is usually harmless, persistent occurrences, especially with other symptoms like greasy texture or foul odor, may indicate malabsorption issues requiring medical attention.

title: Kayla Nicole allegedly targets Vanessa Bryant‚Äôs ethnicity in deleted post
content: Kayla Nicole, ex-girlfriend of Travis Kelce, is accused of racism against Vanessa Bryant. An old deleted post by Nicole targeting Bryant has resurfaced, causing controversy. This comes after Nicole released a music video parody that fans interpreted as an attack on Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce's relationship. Both Bryant and Nicole have remained silent on the matter.

title: Turkish military plane with 20 aboard catches fire mid-air, crashes in Georgia - watch
content: A Turkish military cargo plane crashed in Georgia Tuesday. The C-130 aircraft was carrying 20 people. It took off from Azerbaijan and was returning to Turkey. The crash happened near the Azerbaijani border. Search and rescue operations are underway. Leaders from Turkey and Azerbaijan expressed deep sadness and offered condolences.

title: IRCTC hotel corruption case: Court rejects Lalu, Rabri plea for 1-week gap in hearings
content: A Delhi court dismissed Lalu Prasad Yadav and Rabri Devi's plea for a one-week gap between hearings in the IRCTC Hotels corruption case. The court cited High Court directions for day-to-day listing until witness examination concludes. The case involves alleged corruption in hotel tender awards during Yadav's tenure as railway minister.

title: Happy Children‚Äôs Day 2025: 50 best wishes, messages & quotes to share with loved ones
content: Children's Day, celebrated annually on November 14th, honors the joy, curiosity, and love children bring. This year, in 2025, the occasion serves as a reminder to cherish childhood and nurture young dreams. The article offers heartfelt wishes and messages to celebrate every child's uniqueness and the special spirit of this day.

content: The Mavericks on Tuesday fired general manager Nico Harrison, who had been under fire from fans following last season's trade of Luka Doncic to the Lakers.

title: A. Brown pleads not guilty to attempted murder
content: Antonio Brown's lawyer said he has already filed a written not guilty plea to the former NFL star's attempted murder charge stemming from a May 16 incident at a celebrity boxing match.

title: Jags' Hunter has surgery, out for rest of season
content: Jaguars rookie wide receiver/cornerback Travis Hunter will miss the remainder of the season after undergoing surgery Tuesday to repair the LCL in his right knee.

title: Source: Free agent CB Samuel to join Steelers
content: Free agent cornerback Asante Samuel Jr. is signing with the Steelers on the practice squad, a source told ESPN's Jeremy Fowler on Tuesday.

content: North Carolina coach Bill Belichick said he's "focused" on this week's opponent -- Wake Forest -- and not questions swirling about his potential interest in the vacant New York Giants head coaching job.

content: Phoenix Suns guard Jalen Green will be reevaluated in four to six weeks with a right hamstring strain.

content: Mike Tomlin said he doesn't have any "long-term reservations" about Aaron Rodgers' ability to play the position "at a high level."

title: Locksley confident in job status amid Terps' skid
content: Stuck in a five-game losing streak after a strong 4-0 start to the season, Maryland coach Mike Locksley said Tuesday that he's not coaching for his job as his Terrapins prepare for a Big Ten game this weekend against the 6-3 Illinois Fighting Illini.

content: Could Liverpool end up signing Yankuba Minteh from Brighton & Hove Albion? Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Key Ukraine's Zelensky Ally Accused Of $100 Million Corruption Scheme
content: Ukrainian investigators on Tuesday accused a key ally of President Volodymyr Zelensky of orchestrating a $100 million corruption scheme, as a major standoff over graft in the war-torn country escalates.

title: Sergio Gor Says He Looks Forward Serving As New US Ambassador To India
content: US Ambassador to India Sergio Gor on Tuesday said he looks forward to taking up his new assignment in New Delhi and thanked President Donald Trump for the opportunity to serve as Washington's envoy to the country.

title: Gurugram Police Arrests 2 Rohit Godara Gang Members
content: Under the ongoing 'Operation Trackdown,' Gurugram police has arrested two active members of the Rohit Godara gang, officials said on Tuesday.

title: Congress Leader Shakeel Ahmad Quits From Party After Bihar Polls Conclude
content: Soon after the completion of polling for the Bihar Assembly elections, former Union Minister Dr Shakeel Ahmad announced his resignation from the Congress, saying he waited until voting ended to ensure his decision did not affect the party's prospects

title: Delhi Court Restrains Patanjali Ads Terming Other 'Chyawanprash' As 'Dhoka'
content: The Delhi High Court has restrained Patanjali Ayurved from telecasting an advertisement which termed other 'chyawanprash' products as 'dhoka' or 'deception'.

title: Indonesian Teen Who Was Suspected In Mosque Attack, Built Bombs At Home
content: An Indonesian student suspected in last week's bomb attack on a high school mosque had assembled small-scale explosive devices at home and wanted to copy extremists he found online but had no links with any militant networks, authorities said.

title: Regrettable That Real Perpetrator Not Identified: Top Court In Nithari Case
content: The Supreme Court on Tuesday said it was a matter of "deep regret" that the identity of the actual perpetrator of the heinous Nithari killings was not established despite a prolonged investigation.

title: Bihar Elections Historic, 7.5 Crore Participated In SIR: Poll Body Chief
content: Chief Election Commissioner Gyanesh Kumar on Tuesday hailed the 2025 Bihar Assembly elections as "historic", highlighting the unprecedented participation of over 7.5 crore voters in the Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of the electoral rolls.

title: Those Involved In Delhi Blast Will Face Full Wrath Of Our Agencies: Amit Shah
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Tuesday instructed the security agencies to hunt down each and every culprit behind the Delhi blast that claimed 12 lives.

title: Amit Shah Tells NIA To Submit Delhi Blast Probe Report At The Earliest
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Tuesday directed the NIA to submit its investigation report at the earliest.

title: Hundreds Protest Against Trump Son-In-Law Property Project In Belgrade
content: Hundreds of people staged a demonstration in Belgrade on Tuesday against the planned demolition of a former army headquarters to make way for a luxury hotel complex that US President Donald Trump's son-in-law Jared Kushner wants to build.

title: Delhi Red Fort Blast In Numbers
content: A powerful explosion near Delhi's Red Fort on Sunday evening sent shockwaves across the national capital. The blast, which triggered a massive fire and damaged multiple vehicles, led to a high alert across the city.

title: Red Fort Metro Station To Remain Shut Tomorrow After Suicide Blast Kills 9
content: The Lal Quila Metro Station will remain closed on Wednesday as a precautionary measure following the high-intensity blast near the Red Fort on Monday.

title: Masquerading As Mumbai Cop, 21-Year-Old Extorted Rs 20 lakh, Arrested
content: A 21-year-old woman from Mysuru, who allegedly extorted Rs 20.5 lakh from a man by staging a fake "digital arrest", has been taken into custody by the Alappuzha Cyber Crime Police

title: Maharashtra Opposition Fine-Tunes Civic Poll Plan, Says No Request From MNS Yet
content: Maharashtra's opposition Maha Vikas Aghadi held a key coordination meeting in Mumbai on Monday, focusing on strengthening district-level planning and streamlining decision-making across alliance partners.

title: Man Attacked With Machetes, House Stormed After Argument With Auto Driver
content: A man and two of his neighbours suffered severe injuries when an autorickshaw driver and his friends, some of whom were waving machetes, stormed his house after a minor argument near Kollam in Kerala.

title: NIA Files 3 Chargesheets Against 21 Terrorists Of Banned Maoist Group
content: The National Investigation Agency (NIA) today filed three separate chargesheets before the NIA special court in Hyderabad against 21 terrorists of the banned organisation, Communist Party of India (Maoist).

title: Maharashtra Opposition Fine-Tunes Civic Poll Plan, Says No Request From MNS Yet
content: Maharashtra's opposition Maha Vikas Aghadi held a key coordination meeting in Mumbai on Monday, focusing on strengthening district-level planning and streamlining decision-making across alliance partners.

title: Former West Bengal Minister Partha Chatterjee Released On Bail After 3 Years
content: Former West Bengal education minister Partha Chatterjee, one of the key accused in the cash-for-school jobs scam, was released on bail on Tuesday.

title: 'Baseless': India Slams Shehbaz Sharif's Allegations After Pak Suicide Blast
content: India on Tuesday unequivocally rejected as baseless Pakistan Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif's allegations linking a terror attack in Islamabad to New Delhi.

title: Early bets for Week 11: Bengals and Dolphins to cover, plus an MVP pick
content: the new England Patriots host the division rival New York Jets on "Thursday Night Football" the rest of the day features a plethora of marquee matchups, including the Tampa Bay Buccaneers visiting the Bills, the Seattle Seahawks and Los Angeles Rams . the Denver Broncos hosts the Kansas City Chiefs in a key AFC West clash .

title: Women's bantamweight top 10 undergoes an overhaul
content: a pair of women's bantamweight bouts have reshuffled the ESPN divisional rankings . Norma Dumont won a split decision over Ketlen Vieira on Nov. 1 . jacqueline Cavalcanti defeated Mayra Bueno Silva unanimously .

title: Kashmir imam held in alleged radicalisation drive targeting doctors
content: moulvi Irfan Ahmad Wagay allegedly used his access at GMC and his prayer sessions in Srinagar‚Äôs Nowgam to reach students, identify those seen as susceptible, and push them toward radicalisation . sources described him as a 'key figure' who built and expanded a network that recruited medical professionals, raised funds, arranged logistics, and procured material for IEDs .

title: J&K detains 1,000 in sweep against terror support structure
content: more than 1,000 people rounded up so far in what officials called a 'pre-emptive strike' aimed at dismantling terrorist support networks and preventing attempts to disrupt peace . police said teams carried out surprise checks across districts to create what they described as a deterrent effect against elements allegedly seeking to unsettle public order .

content: Shaheen Saeed is the eighth accused arrested in the ‚Äúterror module‚Äù linked Jaish-e-Mohammad and Ansar Ghazwat-ul-Hind, and according to a government source, her car was used to ferry explosives. The Delhi blast occurred hours after the discovery of 2,900 kg explosive substances and weapons in Faridabad.

title: Differences in fares between budget and regular airlines blur
content: There has been no significant differences in fares between budget airlines and full-service airlines

title: Vijay‚Äôs TVK approaches ECI for poll symbol as it readies for 2026 electoral debut
content: The party‚Äôs joint general secretary C.T.R. Nirmal Kumar submits a list of preferred symbols to the ECI in New Delhi.

title: Welfare pensions could have been hiked to ‚Çπ3,000 had Centre cooperated: Govindan
content: CPI(M) State secretary says various issues, including Sabarimala, will be topics of discussion during local body polls and the LDF government has nothing to hide

title: Karnataka high court grants bail to surrendered Naxalite in Udupi cases
content: laxmi, a native of anantapur in Andhra Pradesh, surrendered to the district committee for rehabilitation of Naxalites on febr 2, 2025 . she was later produced before the sessions court, which denied bail on April 17, 2025, saying she had been absconding since 2006 and a prima facie case existed against her . the high court has granted bail to surrender her in three cases registered in the district between 2007 and 2008 .

title: India improves its rank in climate risk index from 2023
content: Vishwa Mohan is Senior Editor at The Times of India. He writes on environment, climate change, agriculture, water resources and clean energy, tracking policy issues and climate diplomacy. He has been covering Parliament since 2003 to see how politics shaped up domestic policy and India‚Äôs position at global platform. Before switching over to explore sustainable development issues, Vishwa had covered internal security and investigative agencies for more than a decade. Read More

title: 2 engineers from TN killed in hit-&-run on Delhi-Dehradun highway
content: A journalist with two decades of experience, having worked with major news organisations such as NDTV, Times Now, and others. As a Principal Correspondent covering in West Uttar Pradesh, he reports on crime, courts, politics, human-interest stories, and minority issues. His coverage includes key institutions such as Darul Uloom Deoband and Aligarh Muslim University, as well as districts including Agra, Aligarh, and Muzaffarnagar. Read More

title: Delhi blast: First lead to terror plot came from Jaish posters in J&K; attack in works for 2 yrs?
content: Bharti Jain is senior editor with The Times of India, New Delhi. She has been writing on security matters since 1996. Having covered the Union home ministry, security agencies, Election Commission and the ‚Äòprime‚Äô political beat, the Congress, for The Economic Times all these years, she moved to TOI in August 2012. Her repertoire of news stories delves into the whole gamut of issues related to terrorism and internal strife, besides probing strategic affairs in India‚Äôs neighbourhood. Read More

title: Pawan Kalyan proposes Sanatana Dharma Parirakshana Board to safeguard Hindu traditions
content: Deputy Chief Minister says the proposed board will protect temples, promote Sanatana values, and ensure respect for Hindu faith in a secular democracy

title: Rahul‚Äôs Vote Chori campaign will help INDIA bloc in Tamil Nadu too: Selvaperunthagai
content: The Special Intensive Revision of the electoral rolls in Tamil Nadu has opened a debate among members of the public on why such an exercise is being carried out by the Election Commission, says the TNCC chief

title: INCOIS targets faster tsunami alerts using GNSS sensors, AI models
content: Scientists working to enhance early warning systems for tsunamis originating from Sumatra-Andaman subduction zone, aiming to reduce the warning time to less than five minutes

title: SCR launches QR-based ID system for outsourced staff, reviews winter safety preparedness
content: The platform ensures secure, efficient processing with features such as role-based access, OTP-based login, document uploads and a two-level verification and approval workflow before ID issuance.

title: Elevated walkway planned to connect Bengaluru airport metro station with KIA Terminal 1
content: KIA, one of India‚Äôs fastest-growing airports, is currently handling more than 37 million passengers annually and aims to reach over 60 million passengers per year within the next five years, according to officials

title: After AK-47 recovery, Kashmir hospitals order audit of doctors‚Äô lockers
content: In an official communiqu√©, the Medical Superintendent of GMC, Anantnag, directed all heads of departments ‚Äúto identify lockers and almirahs in their respective departments and wards and to label them with the names of the staff members to whom they are allotted‚Äù

title: Naidu to hand over 3 lakh houses under ‚ÄòHouse for All‚Äô scheme on November 12
content: Chief Minister to launch mass house-warming ceremony from Annamayya district; over 3 lakh PMAY houses completed across Andhra Pradesh, beneficiaries to receive keys virtually

title: Supreme Court says SIR is not the country‚Äôs first electoral roll revamp; Opposition retorts that this one is 'farcical'
content: Opposition parties say current SIR is a rushed exercise; ask why Bihar voter roll is included as a document proof for SIR 2.0; call for transparency through acknowledgement slips, machine-readable roll

title: Bengaluru City Commissioners review dog control measures
content: It is important to conduct public awareness programmes to inform citizens about the department‚Äôs initiatives0

title: Mirwaiz condemns Delhi blast; Engineer Rashid to go on hunger strike in Jail
content: Rashid, who is at the Tihar Jail, in Delhi, has decided to go on a two-day hunger strike against the attack from November 12, according to his party

title: Delhi explosion: Kin of terror suspects in shock and disbelief
content: Nabi, the main suspect, was a ‚Äòreligious person and passionate cricketer‚Äô, who laid emphasis on higher studies, says family member

title: Heavy rain likely to occur in isolated places in southern districts of T.N. on Wednesday
content: Light to moderate rain is likely to occur at a few places over south Tamil Nadu and at isolated places over north Tamil Nadu, Puducherry, and Karaikal.

title: KSRTC to offer complimentary Nandini snack kits on Flybus services
content: Transport Minister Ramalinga Reddy will launch the new service at Terminal 2 of Kempegowda International Airport.

title: Ministers review arrangements for Sri Sathya Sai Baba‚Äôs centenary celebrations in Puttaparthi
content: Group of Ministers led by Anagani Satyaprasad directs officials to ensure smooth conduct of week-long celebrations, with focus on traffic, sanitation, and medical facilities for devotees

title: Naidu urged to allocate land in MSME Park for bulk drug units
content: Bulk Drug Manufacturers Association of India seeks 1,000 acres of land in the newly inaugurated MSME Park in Prakasam district

title: Six Maoists killed in Bijapur encounter
content: Automatic weapons, Sten guns, .303 rifles, and explosives have been recovered from the encounter site; Chief Minister hails operation as ‚Äúanother decisive step‚Äù to eliminate Maoism

title: Protest against seaplane project held in Kochi
content: Fisherfolk allege that the seaplane initiative will affect the livelihoods of local fishers in Kochi and other identified areas

title: Centre sanctions ‚Çπ358.82 crore for rural roads and bridges in Andhra Pradesh under PM-JANMAN

title: Ex-forest officer‚Äôs book sheds light on Kerala‚Äôs dark underbelly of wildlife trade and superstitions
content: The author shares real-life undercover operations conducted by the Forest department to curb the illegal trade in tiger skins and other wildlife products

title: Water supply being restored, claims KWA a day after storage tank collapse in Kochi
content: Repair work was carried out on a war footing to avert water scarcity, and pumping began from the second chamber of the water storage tank, says Minister

title: BJP counters YSRCP‚Äôs ‚Äòprivatisation‚Äô charge, defends PPP model
content: Yamini says the PPP model is being misrepresented by YSRCP; clarifies that hospitals and services remain under government control, ensuring free and quality healthcare for the poor

title: Police urge Sabarimala devotees to follow virtual queue, safety guidelines
content: Police warn that unregulated arrivals can disrupt crowd management, affect the smooth flow of devotees, and create safety concerns. Pilgrims therefore should secure a  virtual queue slot before starting their journey

title: Veligonda project will turn drought-prone areas of Prakasam district to fertile lands: CM
content: Assures to complete the project by 2026 and provide water to Kanigiri, Yerragondapalem, Giddalur and Markapuram areas

title: Breaking down each team's City Edition uniform
content: the 2025-26 season marks the ninth campaign of the collaboration between the Nike and the NBA on the uniforms . this year's theme is all about "remixing" previous designs . the "Cream City" threads are back for the San Antonio Spurs and the "California Dream" for the Los Angeles Lakers .

title: After property feud, woman pays hitmen Rs 6 lakh, gets alcoholic son killed

title: Killed your dad, body in bag at home, woman, 40, tells married daughter

title: Spurned Madhya Pradesh man slits woman's throat, onlookers record videos

title: From topper to key terror suspect: Curious case of Lucknow doctor

title: Faridabad university emerges as ground zero of radicalised docs' module
content: i20 car exploded in Delhi on Monday evening killing nine people . police are also probing the role of mohd Istaq, a cleric at a mosque . he managed the emergency wing of the university hospital and had been teaching MBBS studen .

title: Best morning to send a message, says Supreme Court, denies bail in UAPA case
content: siddhartha Dave appeared to acknowledge the challenge in arguing for bail for the accused a day after the attack near Red Fort . he said: 'not the best morning to argue this case after the events of yesterday' he also said he did not indulge in any overt act .

title: Projecting the CFP top 12: Who's No. 2?

title: Passan's perfect move for 21 MLB teams that could go big this offseason
content: a deluge of moves is coming between now and the new year . there are caveats: at least one team on this list will sign multiple players . some players who could be on here are a stretch because of budgets .

title: What's next for Daboll? A split in the 2024 QB class? Solak's second look at Week 10
content: the Giants fired coach Brian Daboll after 61 games at the helm . daboll's Giants are 2-8 for the third consecutive season and end 20-40-1 under his tenure . the most interesting headline to come out of the firing is that general manager Joe Schoen is keeping his job . every Tuesday, I'll spin the previous week of NFL action forward .

title: A drawn knife, an escape by train, a decorated military figure and Georgia Tech's first win
